alert.note: Alert for Southampton; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 5:18PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Southampton and northeastern Sussex Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 518 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ivor, or 7 miles south of Wakefield, moving northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Wakefield around 530 PM EDT. Waverly and Homeville around 550 PM EDT. Sussex around 555 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Vicksville, Dory, Newville, Berlin, Booker, Lumberton, Manry and Littleton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
